column2: So, then he went to the Congress, where he has been a largely very reliable supporter of the NRA.
column4: Says Bernie Sanders "has been largely a very reliable supporter of the NRA."

column2: Unfortunately  unfortunately, I remain one of the poorer members of the United States Senate.
column4: I remain one of the poorer members of the United States Senate.

column2: Well, I believe that the law that Senator Sanders voted for that I voted against, giving this special protection to gun manufacturers and to dealers, is an absolute abdication of responsibility on the part of those who voted for it.
column4: Says Bernie Sanders "has been largely a very reliable supporter of the NRA."

column2: They still want to privatize it.
column4: The Republicans "still want to privatize (Social Security). In fact, their whole idea is to turn over the Social Security trust fund to Wall Street."

column2: When this campaign began, I said that we got to end the starvation minimum wage of $7.25, raise it to $15.
column4: When this campaign began, I said that weve got to end the starvation minimum wage of $7.25, raise it to $15. Secretary Clinton said let's raise it to $12.

column2: Secretary Clinton said let's raise it to $12.
column4: When this campaign began, I said that weve got to end the starvation minimum wage of $7.25, raise it to $15. Secretary Clinton said let's raise it to $12.

column2: We've not had one question about a woman's right to make her own decisions about reproductive health care, not one question.
column4: In nine Democratic debates, "We've not had one question about a woman's right to make her own decisions about reproductive health care, not one question."
